Volunteer.Description:
Google in collaboration with NITI Aayog is focused on bringing Artificial Intelligence related content to India, to train Indian Developers and help them stay ahead of the curve in the technology world.
The Developer Relations team in India is running the Machine Learning Crash Course (MLCC) Study Jam series in India from July to November. Study Jams are a series of free, community-run, in-person study groups. The objective of Study Jams is to raise the technical proficiency of the participants.
Here's a brief overview of what I do as a Facilitator:
Run in-person live session
Guide students through the course material
Complete organizer survey & distribute participant surveys
Show less

Projects.Project Title: Is it a Chhetah, Leopard or Jaguar?
Projects.Description:
Identifies if it is a cheetah, a leopard, or a jaguar by looking at their images. I always have trouble classifying between these three big cats, that's why I thought to make a classifier using deep-learning.
In the project, I created a dataset set by scrapping images from Google Images. I have used about 300 images from each class. This project is inspired by lesson-2 of fastai course. I have made a WebApp for this project with help of frontend template provided by fastai.
I haveâ€¦
Show more

A REST API for predicting house prices in the Bangalore region. Deployed the API on Heroku. The API was made in Flask microframework. The model was by Gradient Boosting Algorithm using XGBoost Library.

Name: Siby Abraham
Headline: Professor of Data Science,  NMIMS (Deemed to be Uni.), Mumbai
About:
As a Professor of Data Science, my career spans three decades and includes tenure at leading institutions. With a PhD in Computer Science, specializing in Machine Learning, and a Master's in Mathematics, my expertise lies in Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Natural Language Processing. I'm committed to fostering an inclusive and empathetic learning environment, firmly believing that trust is paramount in motivating students from diverse backgrounds to excel.
My contributions extend beyond teaching, leading curriculum design and content development across disciplines such as Data Science, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Applied statistics, Mathematics and Bioinformatics. My consultancy work has translated these academic foundations into practical solutions for real-world business challenges.
As an author of forty international publications and my role in organizing significant conferences have established my global presence in the field. I serve on editorial boards of leading international journals and mentor PhD students in Computer Science. My administrative experience is marked by leading teams that embody innovation and collaborative success.
